geomnet 0.2.0.9001

Function for converting a network edge list in data frame form into the correct format for use with geomnet

Source: R/fortify-net.R
fortify.edgedf.Rd

Function for converting a network edge list in data frame form into the correct format for use with geomnet

# S3 method for edgedf
fortify(model, data, group = NULL, ...)

Arguments

model

A network edgelist of class "edgedf". See as.edgedf. Can contain edge variables as well.
data

Data frame containing network node list and other node information. First column should contain node ids.
group

character. Used for facetting. If you wish to facet on network variable provide the name of that variable here.
...

not used in this function

Examples


data(blood)
fortify(as.edgedf(blood$edges), blood$vertices)
#> Using from as the from node column and to as the to node column.
#> If this is not correct, rewrite dat so that the first 2 columns are from and to node, respectively.
#> Joining edge and node information by from_id and label respectively.
#>     from_id to_id group_to type rho        Ethnicity Predominance
#> 1        A-   AB+     diff    A neg            Asian          0.5
#> 2        A-   AB+     diff    A neg         Hispanic          2.0
#> 3        A-   AB+     diff    A neg African.American          2.0
#> 4        A-   AB+     diff    A neg       Caucasians          7.0
#> 5        A-   AB-     diff    A neg            Asian          0.5
#> 6        A-   AB-     diff    A neg         Hispanic          2.0
#> 7        A-   AB-     diff    A neg African.American          2.0
#> 8        A-   AB-     diff    A neg       Caucasians          7.0
#> 9        A-    A+     same    A neg            Asian          0.5
#> 10       A-    A+     same    A neg         Hispanic          2.0
#> 11       A-    A+     same    A neg African.American          2.0
#> 12       A-    A+     same    A neg       Caucasians          7.0
#> 13       A-    A-     same    A neg            Asian          0.5
#> 14       A-    A-     same    A neg         Hispanic          2.0
#> 15       A-    A-     same    A neg African.American          2.0
#> 16       A-    A-     same    A neg       Caucasians          7.0

#> 18       A+   AB+     diff    A pos            Asian         27.0
#> 19       A+   AB+     diff    A pos         Hispanic         29.0
#> 20       A+   AB+     diff    A pos African.American         24.0
#> 21       A+    A+     same    A pos       Caucasians         33.0
#> 22       A+    A+     same    A pos            Asian         27.0
#> 23       A+    A+     same    A pos         Hispanic         29.0

#> 25      AB-   AB+     same   AB neg African.American          0.3

#> 85       O-    O+     same    O neg African.American          4.0

#> 108      O+    O+     same    O pos African.American         47.0
fortify(as.edgedf(blood$edges), blood$vertices, group = "Ethnicity")
#> Using from as the from node column and to as the to node column.
#> If this is not correct, rewrite dat so that the first 2 columns are from and to node, respectively.
#> Joining edge and node information by from_id and label respectively.
#>     from to_id group_to        Ethnicity type rho Predominance
